Desmonus:

* Desmonus�s body quivered for a moment as the new programming began to take 
hold, swamping over and drowning her current.
Her original programming fought as much as it could but in one last shudder 
it was over, lost within the new programming due to her weakness and hunger.
With a sigh/moan Desmonus came to, letting out a breath as her head 
instinctively away from the blinding lights above as her pale green optics 
open.
She was alone in this room�but she knew who she was and who was her 
commander�NO�MASTER.
But the only thing that was on her mind at the moment was finding warmth and 
a meal, her stomach growling at the thought of being full.*


Zyber:

* The sun's light was just beginning to tip over the east rise of the far 
off mountains, the night creatures making their way to their day dens to 
await yet another night in the calm of the wild.
But there was one creature that wasn't scurrying off to the safety and 
warmth of a den to await the next nights hunting, the instincts to reach the 
familiar turf of her home far too strong.
The trees around her thinned out a bit and the ground beneath her feet began 
to turn from soft dirt to patches of solid rock. The crisp smell
of the nights frost reached her nose as she rose over a bluff, her paws 
making no sound as she padded along.
Zyber was indeed ready to reach the warm caress of her den and settle down 
after such a long trek, her joints stiff and sore as well as her muscles 
strained and ready for rest.
She stopped at the top of the bluff and shook the night frost from her fur, 
a sudden scent reaching her snout.
It was strange to her, this new scent.
She lowered her snout to the ground and began to follow it, thinking to 
herself that she recognized this new scent but couldn�t quite place it.
It wasn�t long before Zyber finally found just what the scent 
was�mech-fluid. Stale and old, but the next thing that she saw was the 
source of the fluid and she shook her head at the sight.
Only a few yards away lay a bot in stasis lock ( I�m not sure if DeathSkyth 
is in beast mode and I�m sorry that I spelled his name wrong.)
Zyber walked over to the bot slowly but kept her distance for a moment 
before finally coming up beside him, her head low as she studied just how 
damaged he was.
Well, if she didn�t know anything else then she knew that he was far enough 
into stasis lock to be near death and needed help quickly if he was to 
survive.
Her head lifted for a moment as she began to think of a proper way to get 
him back to her den, and just what she needed to tend to him once she got 
there.*
